text: the reason you're going to marry the
wrong person is because you are yourself
the wrong person you are broken very
difficult to live with afflicted by all
kinds of neuroses and peculiar drives
that you don't even begin to understand
and you know what everyone else is like
you in this respect we are a society
that's desperately searching for the
right person the perfect person even
though everything we know about
ourselves and others suggests that such
a creature simply is not possible on
this earth maybe on another planet in
the realm of angels but basically on
this earth no one is perfect so love is
not a business of getting together with
a completely flawless person it's about
graciously accommodating yourself to the
imperfections of another person and vice
versa
that isn't a tragedy it is in fact what
love is love is being compassionate
generous imaginative about the
complexities of being human in a
mutually tolerant couple romanticism is
a really troubling ideology that's quite
you it's only started up in the mid
nineteenth century but it's taken over
the world and it promises us a range of
really reckless things including someone
with whom you will have a complete
meeting of minds who will understand
your soul someone with whom you will
enjoy fantastic sex not just for a
little while but forever someone with
whom you can combine all sorts of
practical activities with spiritual
quests your lifelong partner your soul
mate now this person doesn't really
exist
it is a made-up person so romanticism
has more or less killed love we need to
enter into a new age what I call the age
of psychological relationships where an
awareness of the basic building blocks
of how our minds are put together
becomes a tool for how to live more
generously and more flexibly around
other people
